ResourceHeader.ResourceName: GOES 13 Energetic Proton, Electron and Alpha Detector (EPEAD) electron fluxes data at 1 min Time Resolution in Spacecraft Coordinates
ResourceHeader.Description: The GOES 13 Energetic Proton, Electron and Alpha Detectors (EPEAD) are essentially the same as the Energetic Particle Sensor (EPS) on GOES 8-12. There are two EPEADs on each satellite, one looking east and one looking west. For more information, please see Onsager et al. 1996, Operational uses of the GOES energetic particle detectors, in GOES 8 and Beyond, Proc. SPIE, Vol. 2812, edited by E. R. Washwell, pp. 281-290, Bellingham, WA. These data file contain mainly information on the electron fluxes with energy with >0.8 MeV from both the A and B detectors. Data files contain long descriptive header.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: NASA Office of Space Science Applications (United States), NOAA National Environmental Satellite Service (United States), Terry G. Onsager

InformationURL.Name: GOES N, O, and P Brochure
InformationURL.Description: Information about the magnetometers onboard GOES 13

AccessURL.Name: Direct access to the GOES 13 Energetic Proton, Electron, and Alpha Detectors (EPEAD) Data
AccessURL.Description: Direct link to the GOES 13 Energetic Proton, Electron and Alpha Detectors data in CSV format as well as the energetic particle data from other GOES spacecraft. The data are sorted by year, month, spacecraft, and file type. The file names indicates the data type, spacecraft number, year, month, and resolution. For example, g13_epead_e2ew_16s_20080301_20080301.csv, indicates GOES 13 magnetometer data at 16 s time resolution from 2008-03-01.

AccessURL.Name: FTPS from SPDF (not with most browsers)
HTTPS from SPDF
AccessURL.Description: In CDF via HTTP from CDAWeb

AccessURL.Name: CDAWeb HAPI Server
AccessURL.Description: Web Service to this product using the HAPI interface.

TimeSpan.Note: Time format in data files is year-month-day hour:minute:seconds. Data file may fill out the first month and last month with flags.

NumericalData.Keyword: Energetic Proton, Electron and Alpha Detectors

Parameter.Name: Seconds of the Month
Parameter.Description: Time format in data files is year-month-day hour:minute:seconds

Parameter.Name: Data points per average
Parameter.Description: Number of data points per average

Parameter.Name: Quality flag for electrons with energy >0.8 MeV
Parameter.Description: Quality flag non-zero value indicates data quality issue

Parameter.Name: Average flux of electrons with energy with >0.8 MeV
Parameter.Description: Average flux of electrons with energy >0.8 MeV from the B detector that faces either East or West depending on the yaw flip of the satellite with no correction applied to remove proton contamination
